info.name: EpicEvents
info.description:
**"epicevents" is the CRM API of Epic Events with a secure back-end architecture. It uses a front-end web django admin interface for super-user and manager and a Django ORM in Postman for seller and support. This documentation is about Django ORM in Postman. It deal with:**
* User
* Client
* Contract
* Event.

The API SoftDesk is coded in Python with DjangoRest and has two applications account and crm.

The data are saved in the PostgreSQL database db_epicevents.

_**Warning: The environnement Environment_OC_P12 must be activated in this collection.**_

# Authorization
* Authorization with bearer Thoken (jwt_access) for 30'.
* login access only to registered user
* There are 3 groups: 
    1. management for super-user and manager
    1. sales for seller
    1. support for support
* The user must be in one of these groups to use the API.
* The crud of user and group is done in the django admin interface by super-user or manager. The managers have read only authorization for all objects in the API for check only. If they need to change an object, they can do it in the django admin interface.
* Normally, the API is for seller and support.
* The sellers whork as a team so they can all create, read and change a client, a contract and an event. Like this a seller can prospect a client and another seller can update his detail. A seller can be a back up of another seller.
* The delete request in not allowed to keep the history of the objects.
* Authorization matrix by group
| Authorization | Create        | Read          | Update        | Delete        |
| ------------- |:-------------:|:-------------:|:-------------:|:-------------:|
| users| N/A | management, sales, support | N/A | N/A |
| groups| N/A | management, sales, support | N/A | N/A |
| client| sales | management, sales, support  | sales |N/A|
| contract| sales | management, sales, support | sales |N/A|
| event| sales | management, sales, support | sales, support |N/A|

item.name: account

request.description:
**Log in a user**
* Fill the body as per next example.
* The users saved in the database as examples are:
    1. admin1 (id1) (management group)
    1. manager1 (id2) (management group)
    1. manager2 (id3) (management group)
    1. seller1 (id4) (sales group)
    1. seller2 (id5) (sales group)
    1. support1(id6) (support group)
    1. support2 (id7) (support group)
    1. lambda (id8) (no authorizations)
* **Attention, for safety reasons, the passwords must be changed after the deployment phase in production.**

**List the registered users**
* The users are sorted by ID.
* For special authorizations see the authorization matrix by group

item.name: contract

request.description:
**List the contracts**
* The contracts are sorted by ID.
* For special authorizations see the authorization matrix by group

**Create a contract**
* Fill the body as per next example.
* sales_contact: write the id of the sale contact
* status: True while contract in progress, by default True when created
* Create an event automatically with contract id and same client id
* For special authorizations see the authorization matrix by group

**Show the detail of a contractt**
* Add the contract ID in the url as per next example
* For special authorizations see the authorization matrix by group

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

request.description:
**Update the detail of a contract**
* Add the client ID in the url as per next example
* For example, fill the body as per next example.
* The client can't be changed.
* Status must be changed to False when the contract is finished.
* For special authorizations see the authorization matrix by group

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS

request.description:
**Update the detail of an event**
* Add the contract ID in the url as per next example
* First, support_contact to be defined by a seller after the contract has be made
* then event_status must be changed to True by a seller meaning event in progress
* For other fields, fill the body as per next example
* event_status must be changed to False when the event is finished
* For special authorizations see the authorization matrix by group
* A particular authorization is that only support defined as support_contact can update an event only if event_status is True

header.value: GET, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS
